video_name: Video 1 - Meeting with Venkat Gopal (Password Protected + Highly Confidential Excel on iPhone)
expected_flow: User should be able to open the password-protected and sensitivity-labeled Excel file smoothly on iPhone via Outlook → Previewer → Excel Mobile. Errors should be presented in mobile-optimized dialogs, state transitions should be stable, and UI should follow Fluent Mobile design guidelines.

issues.title: Web-style error dialog shown on mobile
issues.description: A large-screen web error dialog (with 'Open in Desktop App') appears inside the Previewer instead of a mobile-optimized error message.
issues.expected: Error messages should follow Fluent Mobile design guidelines, with appropriate copy for mobile context (e.g., 'Open in Excel Mobile').
issues.actual: The Previewer displayed a web-style dialog with desktop-specific CTAs and font sizes.
issues.impact: Looks out of place, confuses users about available options, and suggests incorrect flow (desktop only).

evidence.note: Foreground dialog says 'Open in desktop app', sized for large screens.

issues.title: Redundant failure messaging instead of direct app open
issues.description: Previewer fails, then tells the user to open in desktop/mobile app instead of directly handing off to Excel Mobile.
issues.expected: If Previewer cannot open password + sensitivity-labeled files, detect Excel Mobile installation and directly open there.
issues.actual: User sees failure dialog and must manually select 'Open in Desktop App', even though Excel Mobile is available.
issues.impact: Adds unnecessary friction, forces user through redundant steps, lowers trust in product reliability.

evidence.note: User taps 'Open in Desktop App' manually before Excel Mobile opens.

issues.title: Excessive state flicker during password prompt
issues.description: Too many state changes between 10s–13s: blank canvas → header with progress bar → shimmer grid → password dialog.
issues.expected: Minimal, stable transition: load canvas shimmer once, then directly show password dialog.
issues.actual: UI flickers between multiple intermediate states within 3 seconds.
issues.impact: Reduces visual stability and user confidence; product feels disjointed.

evidence.note: Observed multiple flicker transitions before password dialog appears.

issues.title: Password dialog not aligned with Fluent Mobile
issues.description: Password prompt follows native iOS styling, not Microsoft Fluent Mobile guidelines.
issues.expected: Dialogs in Excel Mobile should follow Fluent Mobile type ramp, layout, and branding.
issues.actual: Password dialog appears as a native iOS modal with inconsistent design language.
issues.impact: Creates inconsistency and reduces trust in app’s design coherence.

evidence.note: Password entry box uses iOS native style, not Fluent UI.

meta.notes: Transcript covered ~0–21s. Key problems: inconsistent error handling, redundant flows, visual instability, non-Fluent password dialog.
